column4: hi, i just installed ubuntu, but my grafix are safe mode because the live cd wouldnt boot otherwise. is there any way to fix the screen mode? i hate 800*600..
What is your graphics card?
Hmm, my guess is that it's maybe an onboard nvidia or intel card.
the lspci command run from a terminal should give you a list of your cards
okay, lets see what google turns up on the S3 Unichrome Pro
I've found a post on the ubuntuforums that seems slightly promising
Did you follow the links in the post?  They led to a page that says how to get the card running.
do you know how to get to the folder in a terminal?
preferably although that too can be done from the terminal.
you're going to need to use the 'cd' command (change directory).
Could you prefix your responses with my name?  it highlights them in my chat client, making it easier to read.  Is there a file in there called README or doc or some such?
no there isnt. only viamenu, vinstall_2D and vunistall
wow, that's certainly minimal, well, try typing ./viamenu
and subfolders for several distributions but no readmes
he's starting the installation but all he does is telling me he's denied  permissions
try sudo ./viamenu
when asked for a password, type yours, it won't echo, that's okay.
Did it tell you anything?
yea, asked me to type 1 to install, then told me it was done and how to uninstall
but i guess its not over yet cause i stil got the same gfx obviously
You have to reboot when installing graphics adapters (or at the very least kill X with ctrl+alt+backspace)
okay, i will reboot then! thank you so much for your help, it really makes the difference :)
